intro: Senecio platyphylloides, commonly known as the broadleaf senecio, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its broad, fleshy leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
